jee-main.text:
A block of mass 10 kg is placed on a rough inclined plane as shown in the figure below. If the angle of inclination is 30Â° and the coefficient of static friction is 0.2, what is the minimum force required to keep it in equilibrium?

![Inclined Plane](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Inclined_plane_1.svg/300px-Inclined_plane_1.svg.png)
jee-main.explanation: Calculated by resolving the gravitational force \( mg\sin(\theta) \) and subtracting frictional force \( \mu mg\cos(\theta) \). PYQ from JEE Main 2021.
jee-main.subject: Physics

jee-main.text:
What does this logic gate circuit represent?

![Logic Gate](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/NAND_ANSI_Labelled.svg/200px-NAND_ANSI_Labelled.svg.png)
jee-main.explanation: The diagram displays a standard NAND gate symbol, which outputs false only if both inputs are true.
jee-main.subject: Physics

jee-main.text: Find the integral of \( e^x (\sin x + \cos x) \, dx \).
jee-main.explanation: This follows the standard integral rule \( \int e^x (f(x) + f'(x)) dx = e^x f(x) + C \), where \( f(x) = \sin x \). PYQ 2018.
jee-main.subject: Mathematics

jee-main.text: In a Young's Double Slit Experiment, what happens to the fringe width if the whole apparatus is immersed in water?
jee-main.explanation: Wavelength of light decreases in water (refractive index > 1). Since Fringe Width \( \beta = \frac{\lambda D}{d} \), it decreases.
jee-main.subject: Physics

jee-main.text:
Identify the reaction intermediate in this electrophilic aromatic substitution.

![Benzene Mechanism](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Electrophilic_aromatic_substitution_mechanism.png/500px-Electrophilic_aromatic_substitution_mechanism.png)
jee-main.explanation: The intermediate is a resonance-stabilized carbocation known as the Arenium ion or Wheland intermediate.
jee-main.subject: Chemistry

jee-main.text: Which of the following compounds has the highest dipole moment?
jee-main.explanation: Due to vector addition of dipole moments and bond length variations, \( CH_3Cl \) actually has a slightly higher net dipole moment than \( CH_2Cl_2 \).
jee-main.subject: Chemistry

neet.text:
Identify the labeled structure 'X' in the given diagram of the human heart.

![Human Heart](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e5/Diagram_of_the_human_heart_%28cropped%29.svg/300px-Diagram_of_the_human_heart_%28cropped%29.svg.png)
neet.explanation: The large arching vessel at the top is the Aorta, carrying oxygenated blood to the body. NEET 2019 PYQ.
neet.subject: Zoology

neet.text: Which of the following correctly pairs the cell organelle with its function?
neet.explanation: The Golgi apparatus is principally responsible for packaging proteins into vesicles prior to secretion.
neet.subject: Botany

neet.text: A wire of resistance 4 \( \Omega \) is stretched to twice its original length. The resistance of stretched wire would be:
neet.explanation: When length is doubled, area halves to conserve volume. \( R' = \rho \frac{2l}{A/2} = 4R = 4 \times 4 = 16 \Omega \).
neet.subject: Physics

neet.text: In a typical Mendelian dihybrid cross, the phenotypic ratio in the F2 generation is:
neet.explanation: A dihybrid cross between two heterozygotes yields a 9:3:3:1 phenotypic ratio.
neet.subject: Zoology

neet.text: What is the primary function of the enzyme DNA ligase during DNA replication?
neet.explanation: DNA ligase facilitates the joining of DNA strands together by catalyzing the formation of a phosphodiester bond, critical for lagging strand synthesis.
neet.subject: Botany

neet.explanation: The image shows the chemical structure of DNA, featuring the sugar-phosphate backbone and nitrogenous bases.
neet.subject: Chemistry

upsc.text:
With reference to the cultural history of India, consider the following structural elements of a Buddhist Stupa.

![Stupa](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Sanchi_Stupa_1_diagram.svg/400px-Sanchi_Stupa_1_diagram.svg.png)

What is the top umbrella-like structure called?
upsc.explanation: The Chattra (umbrella) represents the Three Jewels of Buddhism and implies royalty and protection.
upsc.subject: History

upsc.text: Who among the following was the founder of the 'Satya Shodhak Samaj'?
upsc.explanation: Jyotirao Phule founded the Satyashodhak Samaj in 1873 in Pune, Maharashtra, to liberate untouchables and low castes from Brahminical oppression.
upsc.subject: History

upsc.text: Which of the following is NOT a fundamental right under the Constitution of India?
upsc.explanation: The Right to Property was deleted from the list of Fundamental Rights by the 44th Amendment Act, 1978, and made a legal right under Article 300A.
upsc.subject: Polity

upsc.text:
Consider the following map of India showing major ocean currents.

![Ocean Currents](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/67/Ocean_currents_1943_%28borderless%293.png/400px-Ocean_currents_1943_%28borderless%293.png)

Which current heavily influences the Indian Monsoon?
upsc.explanation: The Somali Current is an ocean boundary current that reverses its direction with the monsoons.
upsc.subject: Geography

upsc.text: The 'Global Competitiveness Report' is published by the:
options: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development
upsc.explanation: The Global Competitiveness Report is a yearly report published by the World Economic Forum (WEF).
upsc.subject: Economy

gate.text:
Consider the following directed graph.

![Graph](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Directed_graph_no_background.svg/200px-Directed_graph_no_background.svg.png)

What is the minimum number of edges that must be added to make it strongly connected?
gate.explanation: A graph is strongly connected if there is a path from every vertex to every other vertex. 2 edges must be added to close the necessary cycles. GATE CSE PYQ.
gate.subject: Core Subject

gate.text: In a relational database, a set of attributes is called a 'Super Key' if:
options: It does not contain any redundant attributes
gate.explanation: A super key is simply any set of attributes that can uniquely identify a tuple. It is a 'Candidate Key' only if it is minimal.
gate.subject: Core Subject

gate.text: Which of the following scheduling algorithms can lead to starvation?
gate.explanation: SJF and Priority Scheduling can both cause starvation if shorter/higher-priority jobs keep arriving indefinitely.
gate.subject: Core Subject

gate.text:
Find the steady-state error for a step input in the given control system block diagram.

![Control System](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Feedback_loop_with_blocks.svg/300px-Feedback_loop_with_blocks.svg.png)
gate.explanation: For a Type 1 system with a step input, the steady-state error is zero. Gate EE PYQ.
gate.subject: Core Subject

gate.text: Let \( V \) be a vector space over \( R \) and \( T: V \to V \) be a linear transformation whose characteristic polynomial is \( x^2(x-1) \). The dimension of \( V \) is:
gate.explanation: The degree of the characteristic polynomial corresponds to the dimension of the vector space. The degree of \( x^2(x-1) = x^3 - x^2 \) is 3.
gate.subject: Engineering Mathematics
